website_summaries.verdict: A roof snow rake that is simple to maneuver and won't damage your roof.
pros: Snap buttons provide quick, seamless handle disassembly
Large blade helps users instantly cut through roof snow
cons: Wheels are small and tend to stick

customer_reviews.title: Stronger than it looks
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at the appearance of this product when I opened the box. At first it appeared flimsy until it was fully assembled. I was pleasantly surprised how well it worked on 2 feet of snow on my roof that had been up there for several months. It takes a lot of muscle to pull the snow down but once you're started it works well. My only complaint is the handle sections a machined poorly so putting them together and taking them apart is difficult. A dab of grease helped. I would sand the tapered sections before installing the spring clips. I would purchase this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Decent product.....with a couple of caveats.
customer_reviews.text: A good product with a couple of suggestions for improvement. 1 Put a handle on it that doesn’t come off. Mine did and I made a better solution out of rubber grip mat and duct tape. 2 use a heavier gauge aluminum or even steel on the cross braces. When removing heavy wet snow they can have a tendency to deform. If you aren’t removing 14+ inches of snow that has also been rained on this is a suitable product. If you are, it works....but it has its caveats.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Balzum

customer_reviews.title: Bad rake
customer_reviews.text: Very poorly made, instructions bad, Different parts did not fit had to force support pi ces, had to bend to put in place,silly way to add rollers very difficult to put on actual rake.,edges sharp can be easily cut oneself. The poles ok but so long if you attach all of them (4) it doesn’t work. Top heavy and hard to maneuver. I gave it one star for on time delivery BUT, It is a complete Waste of time (30 min to put together and I am quite handy) and definitely waste of money. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Karen B.NY

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy, but it did the job.
customer_reviews.text: The screws didn't line up correctly and I had to drill new ones. The side supports are like tinfoil. I had to be extremely careful not to accidentally twist it. The little black "rollers" came off with the first "shovel" full. Try as I might I couldn't get them to stay on. It is very light weight, which is important, as when you use all the extensions the weight seems like it is 10X . I actually couldn't maneuver it with all of them. I'm a delicate woman!!! So I guess the "light weight" is a tradeoff for the "flimsy". I do think the side supports should have been better though.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: like Alaska. It was easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: This product is a must with a state that gets a lot of snow, like Alaska. It was easy to put together, it did come with missing parts, the shingle shaver directions for putting together says that there are 2 x 1 1/2 inch screws, it actually takes 3 all were missing, out side of that, overall product is a must have. I highly recommend the Extreme Max 5600 Shingle shaver.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight, light duty roof rake.  Not rugged, but worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Probably give this 5 stars if it wasn’t labeled Extreme Max. I am happy with it, but it’s not super rugged. I use it regularly, but not aggressively. I have had no difficulties with it, but I wouldn’t go jerking on it to loosen snow. However, and this is a huge plus, it is very light. It’s worth the money, no question. Just not deserving of the title Extreme Max. And as others said, the wheels are pretty cheap and don’t roll. But even if they drag, on most snow-covered roofs, they are light enough they won’t do damage. Just think of this as a decent, very light (weight), and light duty roof rake.
customer_reviews.author: R.A.M.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't dig deep enough
customer_reviews.text: With only 10" of snow on my roof I tried it out. It was not hard packed snow. The bracing on the snow rake sits on the top of the snow and so the bottom edge only goes in about 2 inches. I'll have to add a piece of aluminum to it I guess, didn't notice that in the reviews or photos. I won't bother with the wheels either, pretty much worthless in my book.
customer_reviews.author: L. Witt

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I have now use the shovel for my rough for three years now. I live in a trailer . No issues so far. Would definitely buy this shovel again
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: This roof rake is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This roof rake is awesome! It's light, strong, and easy to assemble. The instructions were clear, but assembly as fairly intuitive. I think we're talking 4 bolts and 2 snap on wheels, how much more simple can it get! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Richard G Soto

customer_reviews.title: Great at removing snow
customer_reviews.text: This tool is great for getting snow off the roof. It comes with different length attachments so you will be able to reach even the farthest points on your roof. The wheels on the device helps it from getting stuck and lets you easily remove the snow. The cost of the product is also not to much compared to similar products. I would definitely recommend this product if you would like to keep snow off your roof.
customer_reviews.author: Raj Patel

customer_reviews.title: Just like my Garelick
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a light weight tank. I bought this for a family cabin. I hate getting on top of the roof to shovel when we go up in the winter. Now with this I do not have to. This thing is identical to the Garelick one I bought and i love both.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: The product is fine - shipping not so much
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this and the box arrived very damaged with the end split open. Half of the set was missing including the screws/hardware and the support braces. Returned it and received a replacement but the box was AGAIN very damaged, but luckily the screws hadn't fallen out by some miracle (they're just loose in the box). Extreme Max needs to work at taping up their boxes. Or packaging of the rake in general.
customer_reviews.author: Wyntr Loves

customer_reviews.title: Box missing many parts!
customer_reviews.text: Order back in Dec, got hit by a storm today and opened the box. I'm missing the following parts: - Blade Rollers (2) - Braces (2) - 1-1/2" Bolts (2) - 1/2" Bolts (2) - Locknuts (4) - Snap-Buttons (3) The only thing i have in the box is the Blade, Angled tube, the 3 extension tubes and the Poly Grip. This is unusable
customer_reviews.author: TrueBlue7749

customer_reviews.title: Good rake
customer_reviews.text: It's the rake to get. You will occasionally lose a wheel but replacements are cheap. Have had several rakes. This is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Sigurd Hokens

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes the "best" isnt the Best, just better than the rest.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I do think this is the best Snow rake for the money, which is why I put the time and $ into fixing it. However, I do feel like it could have been structurally designed a little better. It snapped where the head meets the pole & once I reinforced it, you can see where the bolt pulled right through the support arm/blade. I bought 2 other rakes from different companies before I bought this one. I wouldn't advise wasting your money buying a different one, just buy this one & reinforce it as you go.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Nova

customer_reviews.title: didn't break
customer_reviews.text: the metal blade with rollers to protect the shingles worked pretty well. the handle reach is also pretty good, but the handle almost cannot stand the weight of the blade. the little black rubber handle on the end pulled right off, but wasn't needed anyway. I break the plastic ones, so this one passed because it didn't break.
customer_reviews.author: Craig AN

customer_reviews.title: you don't damage or scratch your roof.
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, easy to maneuver, it's easy to adjust and depends how long you need. the two small wheels attached to the 24" blade protect the roof surface. I fully recommend this tool because it is safe you don't need to climb up on your roof, if your roof is high, You need to use a giant ladder because this ladder is sturdy,..
customer_reviews.author: J. Samson

customer_reviews.title: Gets to the roof peak!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to get to our roof peak, it does. This winter we had 3 snowstorms within a month, around 26” of snow before winter started. I wanted to get it off as soon as I could, as the season was just starting! Success!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff L.

customer_reviews.title: This won't last long
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry to say, this product may only make it through a single season. I was disappointed with the flimsy design. The single extension connector on each extension makes it way to flimsy. I will probably wind up attaching the extensions in some other way. Also, the 'wheels" are so cheap. Using the full length and getting to the roof, I plopped it down on the corner of the scraper a few times, so 'protective wheels' aren't doing me a whole lot of good. Read all the reviews, I don't like critiquing products negatively. I'm sure the manufacturer intended this to be a good product.
customer_reviews.author: John J

customer_reviews.title: Steep Roofs are easier to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Good product. If you use it when the snow is light and 5-6 inches deep, it's effective. I ended up on the roof pushing off 23 inch deep slabs and then cleaning off the rest with the tool. Not the tools fault, just too much snow too fast. If you have a really steep roof pitch, it works better.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: It has wheels that worked wonders!
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time yesterday. I was worried because it was lighter than our last one just a little bit. But found it was extremely sturdy and can with wheels on it. This made things so much easier on the roof! It was great! It is nice and wide and I only needed 3 attachments.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: save shingle snow
customer_reviews.text: The two "rods" holding the front panel bends when the snow gets too heavy. It is only good with just two extended rods, when I extend it to the maximum (4 rods), the maneuverability is not good. The black thing that covers the bottom of the last rod, that comes off very easily and got lost in the snow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works as it should
customer_reviews.text: works like it should.. having all the extensions on makes it a bit awkward to handle because I'm short, but luckily I don't need to use the last extension
customer_reviews.author: A Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you have the resource to get needed bolts to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: I dislike the fact that there were no bolts to put it together, Amazon needs to hire trustworthy people to complete the orders, this is the second item I have received without parts to assemble, Amazon needs to fix this personnel problem. For Amazon "Feel free to contact me" I am tired of chasing parts.
customer_reviews.author: KENNY MCCRAY

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to remove leaves from our roof and when it arrived it said “not for leaves only for snow” well I used it and it works perfect (had to wait until rain soaked leaves that were frozen thawed”. Glad I bought it
customer_reviews.author: road warrior 1

customer_reviews.title: A replacement for an older model- not quite as heavy ...
customer_reviews.text: A replacement for an older model- not quite as heavy duty as the older model but works OK especially with the rollers, would suggest breaking the corners of the bottom of the blade a bit, I did with cutters, doesn't hang up as much when of uneven surfaces AND add adhesive grip tape periodically along the poles, they get real slippery with snow and ice
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Rowland

customer_reviews.title: No instructions on assembly and unbalanced
customer_reviews.text: It came in a package that was torn-up and with out any instructions. When I finally got it assembled I was still unable to use it because it is so unbalanced I couldn't even get it onto the roof. I had intended to use it to remove pine straw from my roof which is a lot lighter than snow.
customer_reviews.author: MaryAnn Whitbeck

customer_reviews.title: SYAY AWAY!! GARBAGE
customer_reviews.text: Didn't ship with ANY HARDWARE! I had to find my own nuts and bolts, it comes with only the handles and blade. INCOMPLETE flimsy, and JUNK. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Will do the job
customer_reviews.text: Good roof rake . The angle could be better the assumption that roofs get raked at the same standing level is wrong . A off set angle would be better do to it extreme lightness.
customer_reviews.author: bradforddad

customer_reviews.title: Great pruduct!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I live in MN and just used this to clean snow off the roof. Very good rake and the 21 feet is much better than the standard 16 foot that you can buy retail. I would recommend this purchase if you are looking for a similar item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Bob

customer_reviews.title: A Great Rake and Value. This thing shipped to me very fast. This ones not a cheapy rake.
customer_reviews.text: Now this is a great rake. It is exactly like the one I’m replacing except better. The aluminum rake is a great upgrade. And the poles are the same as I had before so now I have more extensions. How cool is that.
customer_reviews.author: AK Wireless

customer_reviews.title: UPDATED 1-28-19 Waited until it snowed... NO BOLTS, BUTTONS, ROLLERS.  USELESS!!
customer_reviews.text: **UPDATE: I contacted the manufacturer and they were more than happy to send me the missing parts. Great customer service actually.** I thought I'd wait to open this until I needed it. Well, we are having a level 2 snow emergency and I can't put this together. All I have is a couple of polls and a blade. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: MAYA CORTES

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I was worried that this wouldn't hold up to the 7 inches of heavy snow on my roof in Maine. It took about 5 minutes to assemble and took the snow off with ease. The rollers worked as intended, as a shingle saver. This is intended to clean snow off of a roof, not ice, and it does work.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye Ice Dams
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Perfect length for my very tall roof sections. The small "wheels" were a little challenging to install, other than that putting sections together and taking them apart is a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: C. Adam Evans

customer_reviews.title: Roof rake relief
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm. We recently had a lot of snow fall that was wet and heavy. Carports in our park were falling in. This was just what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris P

customer_reviews.title: Light duty use only.
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy, broke and bent when I used it. Granted, the snow was deep, but I was taking it easy because it seemed light duty. It might work for 3 or 4 inches of snow, but if that is all I had I would not bother to remove it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Roof rake
customer_reviews.text: I was happy that it came in a short time,I bought it for a Christmas gift, we have one and it comes in real handy. We use it just not for snow but using the extensions for putting up Christmas tree
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Prochaska

customer_reviews.title: Worked
customer_reviews.text: It works for at least 6" of snow and for the one time we got snow this year. I may tape up the handle a little more as my gloves would freeze to the handle.
customer_reviews.author: BBlack

customer_reviews.title: Great snow rake
customer_reviews.text: Works amazing. Gets snow off roof so high up. Comes off even if ice on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It seems light made, we got some heavy snow and it pulled it down just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Gill

customer_reviews.title: My husband bought this and was very pleased
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this and was very pleased. We live in Wisconsin and get a lot of snow. He used it after our dumping and then ordered another one.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: This thing gets the job done but it is a pain to assemble and disassemble.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Works but blade bends easily
customer_reviews.text: It got the job done but the bottom corners bend pretty easily which allows the wheels to not touch the shingles. Then the bottom of the “blade” is touching (and scraping) the shingles. If it were stronger on the corners this would be another star or two.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to bend, shouldn’t permanently bend under its own weight.
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: Nice rake
customer_reviews.text: Looked the same as the one that was 20 bucks more. This rake works perfect. My only minor complaint was I had to fuss with one of the handle joints- had some burrs and was a little tight No big deal
customer_reviews.author: James Flinchbaugh

customer_reviews.title: light
customer_reviews.text: Used it yesterday and will need to use today with snow storm. Works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence D. Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. Just have to be careful when all the extensions are used.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Larson Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Used last winter. The screws became loose so I used jam nuts on them.
customer_reviews.author: JOD

customer_reviews.title: Great support if necessary
customer_reviews.text: Best roof rake available on the market today! I've used 3 different types over the years and this wins hands down. Also great customer service. I was missing a part for assembly of the blade. I called customer service and they Fed-Exed me the part in less than 24 hours. Let it snow.
customer_reviews.author: CF

customer_reviews.title: deeply disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Both braces broke upon first use. Not made for serious snow. Didn't even bother to install the rollers as they didn't look to be useful in any way. Waste of my time to buy this rake. "Extreme Max"... what a joke!
customer_reviews.author: Tom+

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. So simple to use, even my son in law can do it. 😀
customer_reviews.author: Keith W. Tentler II

customer_reviews.title: Holes don't line up.
customer_reviews.text: Had one but broke it after four years of hard use. New one the brace holes are in different places but made it work and that sucks.
customer_reviews.author: charles h. taplin

customer_reviews.title: Easy enough fix
customer_reviews.text: Might have been damaged during shipping, because it required me to bend out the metal strip on the head to attach the pole. Easy enough fix, just annoying. Overall it's solid, but I am dinging one star as i'm not sure if it was a manufacturing error or shipping damage.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This does the job and works great. The rollers on the rake are functional and the rake is easy to use. I would have given it 5 stars but the assembly was difficult. I had to force one of the stabilizer bars to line up with the hole. Other than that I would totally recommend this product. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Vadnais

customer_reviews.title: It takes at least two people to disconnect or add ...
customer_reviews.text: It takes at least two people to disconnect or add pieces to the pole. The poles don't fit inside each other correctly and the tabs to release don't work as they should. If you are going to use it, I suggest assembling it to the maximum height you need, then wait for help to get it apart again. Not impressed with the quality, but with 3' of snow on the roof and all rakes sold out in my area, there really wasn't much of a choice.
customer_reviews.author: CMN

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Works better than I imagined! Only problem is I have a metal roof and it sometimes catches on the roofing screws.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Jeppson

customer_reviews.title: Missing Screws
customer_reviews.text: Desperately needed this item for our roof in Minnesota with record amounts of snow this winter. Was so disappointed when trying to assemble that i realized my shovel was missing screws. I ordered a new shovel and just found out it wont be delivered till mid April. Very disappointed and will probably return both!! :(
customer_reviews.author: AMC

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok. Work great on fresh snow . Poor on ice
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. Easy on roof snow powder. Impossible on roof ice . Bent plate first use. Side support broke already . Won’t last. Fixed twice and side supports broke again . In the trash now . POC
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems like it will work fine
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a chance to use it yet (of course it decided to quit snowing). Seems like it will work fine, but no real assembly instructions that were user friendly. Took me awhile, but got it figured out!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth it! My only regret: I didn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth it! My only regret: I didn't buy it sooner. It would have made the winters so much easier when we had to climb to the roof and shovel off snow. This is so much safer!
customer_reviews.author: Christensen

customer_reviews.title: It should be great for snow
customer_reviews.text: light weight and maneuverable at full length. No snow here now, but I used it to retrieve a frisbee from roof. It should be great for snow.
customer_reviews.author: ellen munro

customer_reviews.title: Minimal assembly required (screwdriver and pliers needed).
customer_reviews.text: The end of the rake needs to be assembled. Not too difficult
customer_reviews.author: CE

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done, good weight for its size.
customer_reviews.text: Parts fit together except the angled supports between the rake and pole. Maybe they’re supposed to be bent during installation but that’s not clear from the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Bought this...and it has yet to snow.
customer_reviews.text: But, it will happen. And when it does, this will be a great help.
customer_reviews.author: R.-Lorraine Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very handy.
customer_reviews.text: Brutal snowy winter. This worked perfectly. Lot of neighbors got leaks from the ice dams but we were lucky to have this.
customer_reviews.author: A. Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent product in my opinion.
customer_reviews.text: I had read some of the back reviews. I did not have any trouble with the assembling of the blade and the poles connected and unconnected with no issues. I did use a fine file to take down the burrs around the areas that the rollers go. I have used it a few times now with good results and no issues. It’s about 4 feet longer than my old one that broke after about 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: George A. Labonte

customer_reviews.title: Great rake!
customer_reviews.text: This is very light, yet strong roof rake. This is the easiest heavy snow year I've had in years. Great rake!
customer_reviews.author: Mari A.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap material
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy. Used one time and metal support bars broke and the blade bent. Very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Kent Dubord

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Using this EXTREME product for the second time to pull snow from my single story home. The support bars (from pole to blade) already have bent. Wimpy aluminum already bent. Today, the support bar broke in half. Do not buy this product unless you are pulling snow from your roof in Hawaii
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to use for me. I have bad strength in my arms and I had no problem removing the snow.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Serbus

customer_reviews.title: Great rake great price
customer_reviews.text: This roof rake has been working great. I’ve used it 3 times so far on our 2 story home. Nice and light easy to use. I would definitely recommend this roof rake.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy H.

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: The Snow rake is heavier than I anticipated especially when trying to manage when fully extended.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price, good product
customer_reviews.text: A well made roof-rake. Sturdier than my old one which lasted 20 years, but that also makes it a little bit heavier. still a fair trade off should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: had to drill hole in pole for braces the one ...
customer_reviews.text: had to drill hole in pole for braces the one drilled was in the wrong place had to redrill about half an inch back
customer_reviews.author: david larry stanek

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery & it works as advertised. Nothing much else to say about it.
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery & it works as advertised. Nothing much else to say about it.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Real simple to put together and worked great after a six inch snow fall.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H.

customer_reviews.title: Patients, patients, patients!!!
customer_reviews.text: When all the poles are used be careful not to move to quickly. So long and cumbersome
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: For the price you get good value. It probably will need to be replaced every few years. Good for keeping the eves clear.
customer_reviews.author: Gunnar

customer_reviews.title: It works great!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to purchase but I knew we needed something to safely remove snow from our roof in northern Wisconsin. It ripped through the snow with ease. Would recommend this to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use - it did a good job.
customer_reviews.text: I liked that is was light weight. I also liked that it was far reaching and I didn't have to use a ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Want the small parts
customer_reviews.text: Love the whole thing but didn't get the bag of small parts and no way to request.
customer_reviews.author: Katie B.

customer_reviews.title: Not a sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: My husband used it once for about an hour and it broke (rake side support).
customer_reviews.author: Jacquelyn V. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: really long
customer_reviews.text: worked great clearing snow off of roof. And long enough to reach to the top.
customer_reviews.author: todd leitte

customer_reviews.title: Roof rake removes heavy snow.
customer_reviews.text: Remove heavy snow and not ruin shingles. The rake is rigid enough to get through the firmer snow. I bought and extra handle section which makes the job much easier.
customer_reviews.author: John Greenberg

customer_reviews.title: flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Made of very thin material, yes its lightweight but the blade bends easly.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Schlough

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap
customer_reviews.text: Used the snow tool 1 time and it is all bent up. The other one I have had for over 15 years was a lot better quality. Save your money on this item.
customer_reviews.author: Loren Schleusener

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Head end works fine. Pole a bit flimsy as you add extensions. Overall, does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene

customer_reviews.title: GOOD PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: GOOD PRODUCT... JUST COULD HAVE BEEN A LITTLE STRONGER FOR THE BRACING MATERIAL
customer_reviews.author: Dean P Davis-Nitz

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: Supports do not fit. They are not even close. I will have to bend the hell out of them to get them to work which defeats the purpose of even having them there.
customer_reviews.author: Zach DeVoe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for the cost. It is great for removing fresh snow not ice.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: worked great, love the rollers so you won't damage the shingles
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good tool, at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Really very pleased with this item. I most certainly will get a few years use from it.
customer_reviews.author: James Belk

customer_reviews.title: ... then ice then snow then rain yuck its got good
customer_reviews.text: snow then ice then snow then rain yuck its got good reach
customer_reviews.author: chas

customer_reviews.title: Wheels on the blade
customer_reviews.text: Love the wheels on the blade to assure no damage to the shingles
customer_reviews.author: Kaela Krause

customer_reviews.title: Killer shovel!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful snow removal shovel for the roof!!! Love the option for different handle lengths

customer_reviews.title: No hardware was received
customer_reviews.text: The product probably will work fine but unfortunately I didn't get the hardware (nuts, bolts, wheels, rubber track) to put it together.
customer_reviews.author: Lee S Kummer

customer_reviews.title: Poor
customer_reviews.text: Didn't even last a week. Broke after the second time using it.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, one of side supports was not correct length
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, one of side supports was not correct length, had to force to get fastener lined up with hole. Ended up having bent support brace.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Works fine.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be the same as the one offered for over $50. Works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Normal

product_meta.title: Extreme Max 5600.3207 Shingle-Saver 21' Roof Snow Rake with 24" Blade
product_meta.description: Remove the snow from your roof quickly and easily with the Shingle-Saver Roof Snow Rake from Extreme Max Products. Offering a reach of up to 21', there are not many itches this rake can't scratch. The roof rake's 7" x 24" blade comes equipped with blade rollers that give you the close shave you need without damaging a single shingle. Built of lightweight aluminum, this roof rake is easy to maneuver and corrosion resistant. When the job is complete, simple snap-buttons allow a quick handle disassembly for storage in even the smallest garage corners.
feature_bullets: Angled blade offers more use in less space and is effective on low pitched roofs and two-story houses
21' reach with 7" x 24" blade provides superior snow removal
Blade rollers protect your shingles while still providing a close shave
Lightweight aluminum makes it easy to maneuver and corrosion resistant
Easy snap-button handle assembly and disassembly

specifications.Cover Included: Extreme Max 5600.3207 Shingle-Saver 21' Roof Snow Rake with 24" Blade
